title: Gucci Fall 2017 Ready-to-Wear Collection - Vogue

organizations.name: gucci fall 2017 ready-to-wear collection - vogue view slideshow milan fashion week

text: View Slideshow Milan Fashion Week kicked off today with Gucci’s first combined men’s and women’s runway show. Held in a majestically purple space with a central pyramid, the show debuted the house’s new collaboration with artist Coco Capitan, which was celebrated with a giant piece of graffiti outside reading “future.” Inside the space, guests including Jared Leto, Florence Welch, ASAP Rocky, Tom Hiddleston, Soko, and Tavi Gevinson applauded creative director Alessandro Michele’s latest. Welch and ASAP Rocky even contributed their own artistic efforts to the collection, reading texts by William Blake and Jane Austen on a record that was sent out as an invite. For more on the intricacies of Michele’s rich Fall 2017 collection, check back later to read Sarah Mower’s full review.
